name: Avoid programs not having the property I4GLItemsNullable set to NO (EGL)
description:
This rule searches for all the programs having the I4GLItemsNullable property set toYes 
The Default value of this property is NO. 
An EGL program that doesn't have the property I4GLItemsNullable inside its code source will not violate this rule.
output: This report lists the following information: Program Full Name
rationale:
I4GLItemsNullable property must be set to NO
If the i4glItemsNullable property is set to YES, EGL emulates the behavior of I4GL in creating variables as nullable by default (not normally the case in EGL). The default for this property is NO. This property is typically used by EGL migration
remediation: Try to reduce the use of the property I4GLItemsNullable set to YES.
